key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs offer a competitive edge with lower prices in 46.87% of searches, despite showing higher prices 12.96% of the time.
EgyptAir consistently leads in competitive pricing on MSE, with lower prices in over 97% of cases.
GDS platforms maintain price parity with the airline website for 68% of itineraries, while offering lower prices in 25% of cases.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The OTA channel offers lower prices in approximately 47% of cases evaluated, showcasing a competitive edge over airline rates directly.
Price differences when OTA offers higher prices are minimal, averaging less than 1% higher than airline website prices, indicating close parity.
Frequent instances of the same pricing in OTA and the airline's website indicate consistent pricing strategies, with 37.6% frequency reflecting standardized pricing.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The OTA channel offered lower rates in 46.87% of cases, albeit with a slight reduction from the previous week, signaling agile price matching tendencies.
Instances of price parity saw a noticeable increase of 5.62% from the previous week, stabilizing around 37.58% last week, a positive indication of competitive pricing.
With OTAs higher in 12.96% cases, the increase from last week is minor, showing stable pricing pressures from the airline side.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: The short-haul sector displays similar trends as overall averages, indicating no significant regional variations within the OTA channel for last week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from Egypt show greater pricing consistency with OTA low in 34.93% instances, although a dip compared to the previous week is noted.
Non-Egypt origins balanced well with OTAs pricing lower 77.52% of the time, portraying strong alignment with OTA strategies and keeping airline offerings competitive.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Price matching in close-in bookings is significant at 33.79%, with OTAs still offering a 45.17% lower rate, showing competitive pricing dynamics closer to departure.
Far out bookings exhibit OTAs being significantly lower 49.14% of the time, maintaining economic attraction of early reservations with enhanced savings.

mse_highlights.line_content: For EgyptAir, the lower price option on metasearch engines (MSE) dominates, accounting for over 97% of all status checks, indicating a strong price competitiveness on this platform.

The proportion of itineraries where EgyptAir's website and MSE platforms offer the same price remains minimal but stable at roughly 2.6% across all dimensions, suggesting a consistent pricing strategy.
Instances where EgyptAir's website prices are not present on MSE channels are negligible, indicating high data availability and alignment between platforms.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE offers lower prices than the airline's website for nearly 97% of cases, reflecting a strategy to maintain competitive pricing on third-party platforms.
Only about 2.6% of itineraries show the same price on both MSE and the airline's website, indicating aggressive undercutting on MSE.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul itineraries are consistently priced lower on MSE, accounting for all of the lower price status at a near-total rate of 97%, unchanged in recent analyses.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For origin-destination routes starting in Egypt, MSE lower pricing prevails in 96% of cases, with increasing trends compared to last month.
Non-Egypt origin routes offer competitive MSE pricing nearly 100% of the time, although these instances are less frequent.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-In bookings see MSE providing consistently lower prices over 96% of the time, with slight decreases in pricing compared to the previous month.
Far-Out bookings maintain nearly perfect alignment with lower MSE pricing compared to EgyptAir's website, demonstrating a consistent pricing approach for advanced bookings.

gds_highlights.line_content: About 25% of itineraries are offered at a lower price on GDS compared to EgyptAir's website, slightly declining by 0.75% from the previous week and up by 1.71% from last month.
Consistency in pricing is visible with approximately 68% of fares remaining the same on both GDS and the website, showing a minor weekly increase and a slight monthly decrease.
A small proportion of offers (4.97%) were not present on GDS last week, down by 1.05% compared to the previous week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Less than 5% discrepancy as offers not listed on GDS were slightly less than in prior periods.
Over two-thirds of itineraries show no price difference, ensuring a stable GDS offer landscape.
The tendency towards lower pricing in GDS seems maintained with about a quarter priced below the airline's site.
Minimal increase noticed in GDS offering higher prices, sustaining a relatively low occurrence.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes demonstrate consistent pricing similarities, with over 68% priced the same on both GDS and website.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For flights originating from Egypt, 74.6% maintain matching prices with minor weekly changes.
Non-Egypt origins have a moderate GDS lower pricing of 31.8%, but show the biggest volatility with a 5.14% weekly change.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings see nearly 30% of fares priced more competitively on GDS, with a monthly rise of 4.17%.
Advanced bookings remain mostly price-neutral with over 73% at parity, keeping a steady price level.
